intro: Saurauia subalpina, commonly known as the alpine saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe, particularly the Alps and Carpathians. This evergreen shrub typically grows in rocky or forested areas at high altitudes. Its leaves are leathery and elliptical, with a dark green upper surface and a lighter underside. The plant produces small, bell-shaped white or pink flowers in the spring, which are clustered in inflorescences.
